page.title: 15Old people in Solihull.
page.content: We visited{Swallows Court Old Peoples {Home.}It overlooks a big, green expanse where children play. There is accomodation for 64 senior citizens from the age of 60 years old who can no longer look after themselves.. They are encouraged to do as much as they can for themselves. There is also a day centre for more active local senior citizens. About 20 come each day for a meal and to take part in various activities. We interviewed several old people about the changes they have seen in the area. One lady told us that Blossomfield road used to be a lane surrounded by farm land owned by Sir Alfred Bird.Shirley was just a village then. Schools such as Alderbrook and Tudor Grange were built on fields and most of the original farm buildings were demolished.
